ratings.comment: Highly recommend if you're looking to fulfill your language requirement. Darya provides you with additional explanations that are not mentioned in the textbook. I was never bored during the lectures. There is HW every day but it's always fairly easy.

I would highly recommend taking Slavic 101 with Darya. Russian is definitely a difficult language to learn and you will need to dedicate a fair amount of time to the class. She is very helpful and has clear expectations. Participation is required. The textbook is used everyday. Homework is assigned everyday and it is mandatory.

Darya is wonderful. She is respectful of all skill levels and grades fairly with crystal clear expectations. Combined, attendance and nightly homework account for 30% of your final grade and she cold-calls, so expect to work hard inside and outside of class. If you're interested in trying out Russian, I would highly recommend taking her.

Darya cares about her students and enjoys the experiences she makes with them. She puts in all her effort whenever teaching and doesn't let any of her students fall behind as long as they are willing to learn.

I might be biased in giving her a 5 with an average difficulty because I've only taken Russian 1 and I already know some Russian. But trying to be objective, it's not an easy A, it definitely requires some time. But nothing too hard, just tedious.
